bug.short_desc: Acrobat Reader opens while closing Firefox

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Sometimes this happens when closing with Alt-F4 or sometimes just when i press the X. It does not always happen, but when it does, it is really annoying, mostly because Acrobat Reader opens in de background, so i have to go to taskmanager to turn it off.
Reproducible: Sometimes
Steps to Reproduce: 1.browse 2.webmail, youtube, facebook, hotmail, etc, just a few hours of browsing 3. close Firefox with Alt-F4 or the normal way. Actual Results: Acrobat Reader (i have 5 installed), starts to open, than i see nothing, but when i open taskmanager it lingers around in the background.
Expected Results: Just close, and not openening Acrobat Reader
It seems to happen mostly on my W2k machine, i haven't been able to reproduce it on my Windows 7 machine.
you have adobe acrobate reader 5? Update to reader X and see if that helps.
